meanings.definition: To join together again by splicing.
meanings.sent1: I had to resplice the wires to fix the connection.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to resplice the torn seam on the dress.
meanings.sent3: After the magician's trick, he had to resplice the cut rope.
meanings.sent4: She had to resplice her broken heart after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The engineer had to resplice the cables to restore the power.

meanings.definition: To repair a broken or damaged splice.
meanings.sent1: The technician needed to resplice the frayed wires.
meanings.sent2: He carefully respliced the damaged film reel.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to resplice the torn pasta dough.
meanings.sent4: She had to resplice the friendship after the argument.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter had to resplice the cracked wood to fix the chair.

meanings.definition: To reconnect two pieces by splicing them together.
meanings.sent1: The diver had to resplice the broken rope underwater.
meanings.sent2: The artist respliced the torn canvas to complete the painting.
meanings.sent3: The kids had to resplice the torn paper to finish the project.
meanings.sent4: He had to resplice the broken chain to secure the gate.
meanings.sent5: The farmer respliced the fence to keep the animals in.
